main event: Two objects appeared to move in erratic paths, resembling the Pegasus weather satellite in Greensboro in November 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 minutes,The objects were estimated to be one to two hundred feet in size,The observer commented that the sighted objects were likely the Pegasus weather satellite,The report concluded that the objects were probably a weather balloon, an aircraft, or astronomical phenomena,There was only one object officially counted in the report.
sighted object: two objects resembling the Pegasus weather satellite
witness description: an observer who reported the sighting
